intro: Marsdenia geminata, commonly known as the twin-leafed Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicle fruits containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for horticultural purposes.
